item.title: General information about the course
item.description:
Course text: Calculus: Early Transcendentals (7-th (Hybrid) Edition), Author: James Stewart, Publisher: Brooks/Cole Cengage Learning, 2012. Note that this is a customized Hybrid (as well as paperback) version for the University of Massachusetts-Amherst.

Class Material by Section:

  • Chapter 10: 10.1 and 10.3.
  • Chapter 12: 12.1-12.6.
  • Chapter 13: 13.1-13.4.
  • Chapter 14: 14.1-14.8.
  • Chapter 15: 15.1-15.5.
  • Chapter 16: 16.1-16.4.
    Important note: Please, visit the Course Chair's webpage by clicking here and check out "Schedule of lectures" section. We must stick on that!

Grading:

  • Final Exam 25%.
  • Midterms 25% each. There will be two midterms (see the "Exams" section below)!
  • (Weekly) WebAssign homework 10%.
  • Quizzes/Extra homework 10% (TBD).
  • Attendance and participation 5%.
  • The course letter-grade scale is:

A A- B+ B B- C+ C C- D+ D F
90 87 83 79 75 71 67 63 59 55 <55

Homework:

  • There will be weekly online homework assignments using WebAssign. When you buy a textbook make sure to buy also the WebAssign coupon. If you have not used WebAssign before, try to log in here.
  • As a general advice, even working on online problems, please, solve them by paper and pencil too, make copies of your solutions and keep them, say, in a binder, so that you may easily reference that when you are studying for an exam.
  • There will be (almost) weekly quizzes and/or extra homework assignments.

Exams:

  • Midterms:

    • Midterm 1: Tuesday, October 4, at 7:00pm (Room ELAB II 119).
      The material to be covered on Midterm exam 1 is through Section 13.4.
    • Midterm 2: Thursday, November 3, at 7:00pm (Room ISB 135).
      The material to be covered on Midterm exam 2 is through Section 14.8.

  • The final exam for both sections has been scheduled as follows (see SPIRE as well):

    • December 20, at 08:00am (Boyden Phys. Ed. Gym).
      The final exam will be cumulative, with some emphasis placed on topics covered after the Midterm exam 2.

  • Make-up exams (see the "Make-up policy" section below):

    • Midterm 1: Wednesday, October 5, at 7:00pm (Room ILC S331).
    • Midterm 2: Friday, November 4, at 7:00pm (Room ILC S331).

Important Dates/Calendar:

  • Lectures start on Tuesday, September 6.
  • Last day to drop with no record is Thursday, September 20. If you intend to drop, please do so as soon as possible; others may be waiting to enroll in the corresponding Section.
  • Midterm 1 is on Tuesday, October 4.
  • Columbus Day is on Monday, October 10. Thus, Tuesday, October 11 will follow Monday schedule.
  • Last day to drop with "W" and select P/F is Thursday, October 20.
  • Midterm 2 is on Thursday, November 3.
  • Veterans' Day is on Friday, November 11.
  • Thanksgiving recess begins on Sunday November 20 and classes resume on Monday, November 28.
  • Last day of classes is on December 14. Then, reading days are December 15 and 17.
  • Semester ends on December 23.

Calculators/Make-up policy:

  • Calculators:

    • You will be allowed to use a calculator on exams, but only to perform arithmetic calculations.
    • You must show all work other than arithmetic calculations.
    • Absolutely no formula sheets, class notes, etc. will be allowed during final and midterm exams.
    • Learning and memorizing formulas takes time. Thus, do not postpone this until the last minute.

  • Make-up policy:

    • Make-up exams will only be given for reasons described here.
    • Above all, remember that you have to notify me at least two weeks in advance.
